results.title: People of Hawaii
results.brief_description: Portrays some of the ways in which American industrial civilization has influenced native Hawaiian culture. An introduction to certain major aspects of modern life in Hawaii: scientific agriculture as exemplified in the best pineapple and sugar-cane plantations; small-scale native craftsmanship; the blending of many ethnological types which comprise the modern Hawaiian population and the survival of fragments of an earlier Hawaiian culture in present day recreational activities.

results.title: People of Greece
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Surreys modern Greece, showing how the rugged topography, the relative infertility of the soil, and the lack of natural wealth have influenced the agriculture and industries of the country. Depicts aspects of life in Greece, showing details of costume, religious and social customs, rural and urban activities, and examples of ancient and modern architecture. Includes scenes of Athens.

results.title: People like you
results.brief_description: A recruiting film of general interest, People Like You introduces its audience to members of the Canadian Armed Forces Reserves, who serve as a volunteer force both at home and abroad. They engage in a variety of activities, such as providing civilian rescue services, patrolling the environment, evacuating the sick, and other public assistance functions.

results.title: People here really aren't idiots
results.creator_credit: Tristram Miall and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: The work of a halfway house in Sydney, providing accommodation for young people referred from other agencies such as prisons and psychiatric hospitals. The residents stay for approximately a year, find a job, pay rent, and find in the house a stable environment to help them over the acute stages of adjustment, with the opportunity to interact amongst themselves and with outsiders.

results.title: People are the main part of any deal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Boss Class”.
In part Two the problems of management are further discussed with particular reference to industrial relations, training and consultation of staff and fringe benefits. Summarises three problems facing industry - innovation, computerisation and containerisation.

results.title: People along the Mississippi
results.brief_description: The adventures of a toy boat, released at the source of the Mississippi River are used to show the work of the people living along the course of the river and the heritages that these people have brought to America from their former homeland. A French-Canadian boy launches the boat, marked with his name and address. From along the river he receives letters telling of the adventures of this boat: from a Chippewa boy, from Swedish-American towboat captain; from a boy descended from early German migrants, from a girl who is a descended from the pioneers who came west, from a Negro and white boy on the cotton land of the South and from a girl living on the coast of the Gulf of Mexico.

results.title: People + leisure = [People plus leisure equals]
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, British Petroleum and Pilot Films
results.brief_description: With industrialisation in Britain, more people have more time to spend on leisure activities. Made in Co-operation with The Countryside in 1970 Movement, this film examines the growing pressures that increased opportunities for leisure activities bring, particularly among people living in cities. Describes the problems that result from too many people attempting to utilise the inadequate facilities and the impact these pressures put on the countryside generally. Discusses the need for proper planning of future recreational facilities.

results.title: People's dictator
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Chinese politician Deng Xiao Ping, a man who holds no official office in China, but runs the country as a virtual dictator. He has been credited as beign the one man who brought China from the brink of starvation to become one of the leading developing nations of the world. His policy of socialism is viewed by many in the West as being a form of Capitalism, but he will be remembered most by his people as the one dictator in 5,000 years of Chinese history who was determined to suppress a non-violent protest with extreme force - Tienamen Square.
